message_1: Suppose you have a message "HELLO" that needs to be encrypted using a substitution cipher. The substitution rule is to shift each letter by 3 positions in the alphabet, so A becomes D, B becomes E and so on. What is the encrypted message for "HELLO"?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using the given substitution cipher, we shift each letter by 3 positions in the alphabet:

H -> K (shifted 3 positions: I, J, K)
E -> H (shifted 3 positions: F, G, H)
L -> O (shifted 3 positions: M, N, O)
L -> O (shifted 3 positions: M, N, O)
O -> R (shifted 3 positions: P, Q, R)

So, the encrypted message for "HELLO" is "KHOOR".
